outline: Rob was upset about some things the city council was doing.
Lisa had a house cat Ruffles.
Rob was against them instituting permit parking on Rob's street.
Ruffles always stayed inside.
Rob organized a petition and collected numerous signatures.
One day Ruffles wanted to go outside.
Rob also spoke at several city council meetings.
Ruffles walked out.
Thankfully, Rob was able to prevent the measure from being implemented.
Luckily Lisa caught Ruffles in time.
responses:
Rob was a man who took pride in his community. He had lived in the same house for over twenty years and had seen the neighborhood change in many ways. Recently, however, he had become upset about some things the city council was doing. They were instituting permit parking on his street, and Rob was against it.

Rob knew that many of his neighbors felt the same way, so he organized a petition and collected numerous signatures. He also spoke at several city council meetings, passionately arguing against the measure. Rob felt like he was making a difference, but there was one thing that he couldn't control.

Lisa, his neighbor across the street, had a house cat named Ruffles. Ruffles always stayed inside, but one day she wanted to go outside. Lisa was hesitant at first but eventually gave in. As Ruffles walked out, Rob noticed and became worried.

He knew that the permit parking would make it difficult for Lisa to park near her house, which could put Ruffles in danger. Rob tried to catch Ruffles, but she was too quick. Thankfully, Rob was able to prevent the measure from being implemented. He felt like he had accomplished something significant, but his satisfaction was short-lived.

As Rob walked back to his house, he saw Lisa standing on her porch, looking distressed. Rob approached her and asked what was wrong. Lisa explained that Ruffles had gotten out, and she couldn't find her. Rob immediately offered to help.

Together, they searched the neighborhood, calling Ruffles' name. After what seemed like hours, they finally found her. She was sitting on a neighbor's fence, looking down at them with a curious expression. Lisa was overjoyed and thanked Rob for his help.

As they walked back to their houses, Lisa asked Rob why he had fought so hard against the permit parking. Rob explained that he wanted to protect his community, and that included the pets that lived in it. Lisa nodded in agreement, and they said their goodbyes.

Rob walked into his house feeling grateful for the experience. He knew that he had made a difference, not just for his community but also for Ruffles. As he sat down on his couch, he smiled, knowing that he had done the right thing.

outline: Sam saw his brother Barry eating a peanut butter and banana sandwich.
Holly had always wanted to pursue a Master's in Public Health.
Sam thought it was the grossest thing Sam ever saw.
Holly worked hard academically to maintain a good grade point average.
Barry told Sam to try it himself, but Sam refused.
Holly also interned with the local Health Department to gain experience.
After many weeks, Sam reluctantly agreed to take a bite.
During Holly's senior year Holly was able to apply to graduate schools.
Sam now eats peanut butter and banana sandwiches every week.
Holly's internships and grades earned Holly a spot in graduate school!
responses:
Sam and Barry were always close, but they had very different tastes. While Barry loved peanut butter and banana sandwiches, Sam thought they were the grossest thing he ever saw. One day, Sam walked into the kitchen to see Barry munching on his favorite sandwich. He cringed at the sight and turned to leave, but Barry called out to him.

"Come on, try it! You might like it," Barry said, holding out a half-eaten sandwich.

Sam shook his head. "No way, that's disgusting."

Meanwhile, Holly had always been interested in public health. She worked hard to maintain a good grade point average and interned with the local Health Department to gain experience. During her senior year, she was able to apply to graduate schools.

"I'm so excited," Holly told her family at dinner one night. "I've always wanted to pursue a Master's in Public Health."

Over the weeks that followed, Barry continued to eat his beloved sandwich, and Sam continued to refuse. Until one day, after much persuasion from Barry, Sam reluctantly agreed to take a bite.

To his surprise, Sam found that he actually enjoyed the sandwich. "I can't believe I'm saying this, but this is actually pretty good," he said, taking another bite.

As Holly's graduation approached, she was thrilled to learn that her hard work had paid off. Her internships and grades earned her a spot in graduate school.

"I couldn't have done it without all of your support," she told her family. "I'm so grateful."

Now, every week, Sam makes himself a peanut butter and banana sandwich for lunch. He never thought he'd be a fan, but he can't get enough. And as Holly sets off on her new journey, her family knows that she'll continue to work hard and achieve great things.

outline: Cindy loves her coworkers but has never attended happy hour with them.

One day Cindy's best friend at work convinces Cindy to come along.
But when Nellie woke, Nellie panicked.
Cindy goes to happy hour with her coworkers and Cindy's coworkers all drink beer.
Nellie was covered head-to-toe in heavy wet sand!
Cindy is very pleased that Cindy joined happy hour with Cindy's coworkers.
Nellie's little brother had buried Nellie in sand while Nellie slept!
responses:
Cindy had always been fond of her coworkers, but she never attended their happy hour gatherings. She was afraid that drinking with them would be perceived as unprofessional. One day, however, Cindy's best friend at work convinced her to come along. Cindy was hesitant at first but eventually gave in.

Meanwhile, Nellie decided to take a nap on the beach. She dozed off peacefully for a few hours. But when she woke up, she panicked. She was covered from head to toe in heavy, wet sand! It turned out that Nellie's little brother had buried her in sand while she slept.

Back at the happy hour, Cindy was surprised to see that her coworkers all drank beer. She was a bit nervous, but she decided to order a drink as well. To her delight, she found that her coworkers were very welcoming and friendly. Cindy was pleased that she had joined them.

Nellie eventually made it to the happy hour, but she was still covered in sand. Her coworkers were amused but sympathetic. They offered her a towel and a drink, and Nellie finally relaxed. She was grateful for their kindness.

In the end, Cindy realized that she had been missing out on a lot of fun by not attending happy hour with her coworkers. She was glad that she had stepped outside her comfort zone and had a great time with her colleagues. And as for Nellie, she learned to be more careful when taking naps on the beach!

Larry awakes one night to a sound. He tries to ignore it at first, but it persists. He decides to investigate and gets up to see if anyone is around. As he descends the stairs into the kitchen, he realizes the sound is coming from there. 

He scans the area but sees no one except for his family's kitten. The kitten seems to be playing with something on the floor. Larry approaches to see what it is and discovers a broken nail. 

Meanwhile, Kelly is at the local salon getting her nails done. She chooses to paint them red and is excited to show them off to her friends and family. However, as soon as she steps out of the salon, she realizes that one of her nails has already broken. She's upset but tries to brush it off.

Larry heads back to bed and rests easily, not giving the broken nail another thought. But Kelly can't shake her disappointment and frustration. She had been looking forward to her new nails and now one of them is ruined. She tries to hide it as best she can, but her mood is noticeably dampened.

The next day, Larry notices that Kelly seems to be upset about something. When he asks her what's wrong, she hesitates at first but finally admits the truth about her broken nail. Larry is sympathetic and tries to cheer her up. He suggests they go out for a fun activity together. Kelly agrees, and the rest of their day is spent enjoying each other's company.

In the end, Larry's small act of kindness helps to lift Kelly's spirits and she realizes that her broken nail is just a minor setback. She's grateful to have someone like Larry in her life who cares about her well-being.

Meanwhile, Marcus noticed that he got dizzy when he got up in the morning. He wasn't old enough for that to be normal, so he called his doctor. The doctor hemmed and hawed for a few minutes before suggesting that Marcus drink more water every day. Marcus followed the doctor's advice, and that solved the problem.

Ronald continued to attend his Anatomy class, and with each lesson, he became more comfortable with the material. He was amazed at the complexity of the human body and how all the organs worked together. He was grateful for the group project that allowed him to work with the three women who were knowledgeable and supportive.

In the end, Ronald realized that college was not as scary as he thought it would be. He was grateful for the experience and the chance to learn something new. Marcus was also happy that he took action to solve his health issue. It was a reminder to always listen to your body and seek help when necessary. Meanwhile, Corey had just started a new job that brought more stress than he was used to. He wanted to keep working, but he needed to find a way to deal with the stress. His friend suggested he start practicing meditation, and Corey decided to give it a try.

As Corey researched meditation techniques, he found one that worked for him. He began to practice every day, and soon he noticed that he was becoming much less stressed. He was happy to keep working and grateful for the advice his friend had given him.

One day, Laney had had enough. She couldn't take her boss's mistreatment anymore, and she quit on the spot. She was glad she had stood up for herself, even though she didn't have another job lined up.

Corey continued to practice meditation and found it to be a valuable tool for dealing with stress. He was grateful for the positive change it had brought to his life, and he was happy to see that Laney had also made a positive change for herself.

responses:
Ray was in a bind. His mother's birthday was coming up, and he had no idea what to get her. He knew she had taken up an interest in fitness and exercise, but he didn't know where to start looking for a gift. That's when he remembered the fitness instructor he had met a few weeks ago. Perhaps they could offer some advice?

Ray found the instructor and explained his predicament. The instructor immediately recommended a Fitbit - a device that tracks steps, heart rate, and other fitness-related metrics. Ray was thrilled; this seemed like the perfect gift for his mother.

The only problem was money. Ray's friend Joel was notoriously stingy with his finances, always hoarding his money in case of an emergency. Ray knew that he needed to ask Joel for help, but he was hesitant to do so. Finally, he mustered up the courage to ask Joel for a loan.

Joel was hesitant at first but eventually relented. Ray had never asked for money before, and Joel knew how much his friend loved his mother. So Joel gave Ray the money he needed, although he made it clear that he hoped Ray would pay him back promptly.

Ray went out and bought the Fitbit, which was more expensive than he had anticipated. But he knew it was worth it. His mother was ecstatic when she opened the gift, and Ray was thrilled to see her so happy.

As for Joel, he felt regretful. He realized that he had spent his whole life saving money and never taking vacations or buying things for himself. Now that he was retired, he wished he had enjoyed his life more. But he was happy to see Ray's mother so delighted with her gift, and he felt a sense of pride in helping make it happen.

Paul stopped at a café to grab another cup of coffee, not wanting to go to work without his caffeine fix. Mark, on the other hand, decided to sell his chosen piece to someone at the fair and made a whopping $10,000.

Despite Paul's coffee mishap, the day turned out to be a success for Mark. As for Paul, he learned to always double-check his ingredients before making his coffee.

As Kelly was leaving the salon, she accidentally broke one of her freshly painted nails. She was so upset that she couldn't help but cry. Bob and Karen stumbled upon her while they were strolling downtown, trying to figure out what to do. They were surprised to see so many cars on the road.

Meanwhile, Dina was preparing for her wedding in two weeks, and her friend Colleen was serving as her maid of honor. But as the big day approached, Dina began to get nervous. Thankfully, Colleen was there to support and calm her down.

Emma, still feeling hurt and rejected, decided to take drastic actions to show the world her pain. She walked under a mattress for an entire year, hoping to make a statement about her unrequited love for Paul.

As the wedding day neared, Dina hoped her nerves wouldn't get the best of her. She just wanted to enjoy her special day with her loved ones. In the end, despite the drama and heartache, everyone came together to celebrate Dina's wedding, and she was able to have the beautiful day she had always dreamed of.

outline: Phil worked his way up from cook to general manager.

Phil kept at it and the place was more popular than before.

responses:
Phil had worked at the restaurant for years, starting out as a lowly cook and eventually working his way up to general manager. When the owner retired, Phil saw an opportunity and purchased the place, renaming it "Phil's". 

Meanwhile, one of Phil's employees, Kim, had an online diary that she wrote in daily. She was very candid and put everything in the diary, including her frustrations with her boss. 

Phil found it difficult to run the business, as there were many new responsibilities to manage. There were times he wished he was still just an employee. 

One day, Kim was particularly upset with Phil and wrote a scathing post about him in her diary. However, she soon realized that she had accidentally posted the entry on her public Facebook profile instead. 

Despite the setback, Phil kept at it and the restaurant became more popular than ever before. However, the damage had been done and everyone had seen Kim's post. She was fired the next day for her unprofessional behavior. 

In the end, Phil learned that running a business was not easy, but with hard work and dedication, he was able to succeed. And as for Kim, she learned the hard way that social media can have serious consequences.

outline: Ruth's neighbor was religious.
Maggie had been in trouble with the law when she was younger.
Ruth's neighbor invited Ruth over for a bible study.
When Maggie married and had a kid, Maggie was a great mom.
Ruth reluctantly agreed.
Maggie and her husband divorced and her husband filed for custody.
Ruth and her neighbor read several passages and discussed them.
The judge held Maggie's past against her and ruled for her husband.
When Ruth and her neighbor were done, Ruth went home.
Maggie, despondent, fell back into a life of crime.
responses:
Ruth had always been a private person, content to keep to herself in her cozy little house on the outskirts of town. But her neighbor, a devoutly religious woman, had been persistent in her attempts to bring Ruth into the fold. She had invited Ruth over for a bible study several times, but each time Ruth had politely declined.

It wasn't until Maggie moved in next door that Ruth began to reconsider. Maggie had a troubled past, having been in trouble with the law when she was younger. But now, as a married mother, she seemed to have turned her life around. Ruth couldn't help but be impressed by how devoted Maggie was to her child. 

So when Ruth's neighbor extended yet another invitation, Ruth reluctantly agreed. She arrived at her neighbor's house to find Maggie already there, eager to learn more about the bible. Together, the three women read several passages and discussed them.

But life is never as simple as it seems. Maggie's husband soon filed for divorce and custody of their child. The judge held Maggie's past against her and ruled in her husband's favor. Maggie was devastated.

Ruth and her neighbor continued their bible studies, but as time went on, Ruth noticed that Maggie seemed to be withdrawing. One day, when Ruth returned home from her neighbor's house, she found police cars outside of Maggie's house. Maggie had fallen back into a life of crime, unable to cope with the loss of her child.

Ruth was heartbroken for Maggie, but she couldn't help but feel a sense of relief that she had never gotten too involved in her neighbor's life. Sometimes, it's better to keep a healthy distance.

Meanwhile, Cindy loved her coworkers but always felt it was unprofessional to attend happy hour with them. She was afraid of how it would look to her boss and colleagues. But one day, her best friend at work convinced her to come along, and she reluctantly agreed.

As Cindy arrived at the bar, she noticed that all her coworkers were drinking beer. She wasn't a fan of beer, but she decided to join in on the fun anyway. Meanwhile, Stan looked at himself in the mirror and decided it was time for a change. He got out a razor and shaved off his hair.

As the night went on, Cindy found herself enjoying the company of her coworkers and even tried a few sips of beer. She was surprised by how much fun she was having and was grateful for her friend's encouragement. Meanwhile, Stan arrived at the bar with his new look, feeling liberated and free from his obsession with the singer.

At the end of the night, Cindy was very pleased that she had joined happy hour with her coworkers. She realized that it wasn't unprofessional to let loose and have fun with the people she worked with. And Stan learned that it was okay to let go of things that no longer served him. They both went home that night feeling a little lighter and a lot happier.

Gabe rode his bike to school each morning, enjoying the fresh air and exercise. Marissa often walked the same route, lost in thought about her upcoming sweet 16. One morning, Gabe hit a rock and fell off his bike, spraining his ankle.

Luckily, a neighbor found Gabe and called his mother. She picked him up and brought him to the doctor. Marissa's parents were planning a surprise sweet 16 party for her at their home and were busy making preparations. They wanted to make it a special day for their daughter.

The day of the party arrived, and Marissa was in shock as she walked into her parents' beautifully decorated home. Friends and family had gathered to celebrate her milestone birthday. The party was a success, and Marissa felt loved and appreciated.

As the party drew to a close, Gabe's mother arrived with him in tow. Marissa's parents welcomed them both with open arms, thrilled to have them there to share in the festivities. Gabe was still nursing his injured ankle, but he was happy to be part of the celebration.

In the end, Marissa's sweet 16 was a day she would never forget. She felt grateful for her family and friends and was touched by Gabe's presence despite his injury. It was a day of joy and happiness that would be remembered for years to come.

outline: Anita browsed the aisles of the local candy store.

The shopkeeper noticed Anita and glared.
The cat was curious.
Anita never felt so guilty in Anita's life.

responses:
Anita strolled down the street, her thoughts wandering aimlessly as she browsed the aisles of the local candy store. She had no intention of buying anything, but her gaze was drawn to a container of gummy bears that caught her eye. She hesitated for a moment, then discreetly put a handful in her pocket.

As she turned to leave, she noticed a man with a small cat in his arms. The cat always ran from him, and he seemed to be trying to coax it into playing with him. Anita watched as he bought a bright ball of yarn and left the store.

Just as she was about to follow, the shopkeeper noticed her and glared. Anita hurriedly left the store, feeling guilty for taking the gummy bears. She watched as the man and his cat played with the yarn together, the cat finally coming out of its shell.

Anita never felt so guilty in her life. She knew she had done something wrong, but she couldn't bring herself to confess. She watched from afar as the man and his cat continued to play, the yarn leading them on a wild chase through the streets.

As the sun began to set, Anita made her way home, her mind still heavy with guilt. But as she thought about the man and his cat, she couldn't help but smile. Maybe there was still some good in the world, she thought, as she settled in for the night.

One day, David decided to ask the new business owner what his secret was. The owner told David that the key to success was online marketing. David realized that he needed to take his business online to stay competitive.

Finally, Mary found a blue dress that looked very pretty. On prom night, everyone commented on how lovely she looked. Mary felt happy and confident in her dress.

David took the owner's advice and paid an SEO firm to put his business on the front page of Google. His business started to pick up, and he was finally able to compete with the new business.

In the end, Mary had a great time at prom, and David's business was thriving again. They both learned that sometimes, the key to success is to adapt and change with the times.

As Neil arrived at the Black Forest, he couldn't help but think of the German fairy tales set in this location. He found the forest to be both spooky and beautiful at the same time. He wandered through the trees, taking in the sights and sounds.

As Neil's train ride came to an end, he realized that his trip to Germany had been unforgettable. He had seen so many beautiful places, but the Black Forest would always hold a special place in his heart.

As they continued their walk, the sky started to darken, and before they knew it, it started to rain hard. Dawn and Joyce took off running towards the house, while Jen trailed behind. Disappointed, Jen made her way back to the house, where Dawn and Joyce were waiting for her. They were both so cold and wet that they had to change their clothes. Jen decided that she would save up for the bag she wanted. She also took on extra hours at work to help her reach her goal.

Days turned into weeks, and Jen worked hard, saving every penny she could. Finally, the day arrived when she had enough money to buy the bag. She walked into the store with a big smile on her face and purchased the bag she had been dreaming of.

Jen was overjoyed and couldn't wait to show her friends. She met up with Dawn and Joyce, and they were amazed by the bag. They were also proud of Jen for achieving her goal. Even though they had gotten cold and wet on their walk, it had all been worth it in the end.

Tim had always wanted a pet cat, but every time he brought one home, they would run away from him. However, this time was different. The moment he laid eyes on this little ball of fur, he knew that they were meant to be together.

Meanwhile, John had always been fascinated by cars and had dreamed of racing professionally. So when he got an opportunity to participate in a local race, he jumped at the chance. Despite never having done it before, John was excited to see what he could do.

As Tim spent time with his new furry friend, he realized that the cat loved to play with anything that was bright and colorful. So he bought a bright ball of yarn and was delighted to see the cat chase it around the room.

On the day of the race, John was nervous but determined. He knew that he had a lot to learn, but he was ready to give it his all. Unfortunately, John didn't come close to winning. But he was just glad that he had been able to complete the race without any major issues.

Meanwhile, the cat had been curious about the yarn and had been watching Tim play with it. So when Tim and his cat played with the yarn together, it was a moment of joy for both of them.

outline: Annie remembered standing at this same quilt show last year.

Annie reflected on all Annie had experienced and accomplished.
The birds glare at Daniel through the window if they are not fed.
The judging had just finished.
When Daniel fills the feeders, the birds alert their friends by chirping.
Annie had earned an honorable mention ribbon.
After fresh food is supplied, Daniel loves seeing the birds so happy.
responses:
Annie stood at the quilt show, her eyes scanning the room. She remembered being here last year, admiring the intricate patterns and vibrant colors of the quilts on display. But this year was different. This year, Annie had a quilt of her own on display.

As she stood there, lost in thought, a man named Daniel caught her eye. He was gazing out the window, smiling as he filled the bird feeders in his yard. Annie watched as a flurry of birds descended upon the feeders, each vying for a spot to eat.

She couldn't help but smile at the sight. Annie reflected on all she had experienced and accomplished to get to this point. She had poured countless hours into her quilt, carefully choosing each fabric and stitch. And now, here it was, on display for all to see.

The judging had just finished, and Annie was feeling nervous. She knew the competition was fierce, but she couldn't help but hope for the best. As she made her way to the quilt, she noticed Daniel walking towards her.

"The birds glare at me through the window if I don't feed them," he said with a chuckle. "They're quite demanding."

Annie laughed, grateful for the distraction. As they chatted, Daniel told her about his love for watching the birds and the joy it brought him to see the wide variety of species that they attracted.

Suddenly, there was a commotion in the room. The judges had finished their deliberations, and the winners were about to be announced. Annie felt her heart pounding as the ribbons were handed out one by one.

Finally, the moment arrived. Annie had earned an honorable mention ribbon. She felt a surge of pride and happiness wash over her. As she made her way out of the quilt show, she couldn't help but think of Daniel and the birds in his yard.

Later that day, Daniel was outside filling the bird feeders once again. As he poured in the fresh food, the birds chirped excitedly, alerting their friends to the new feast. Daniel watched as they descended upon the feeders, their tiny bodies hopping and fluttering with delight.

He felt a sense of joy and contentment wash over him. As he looked out at the birds, he couldn't help but remember Annie and her beautiful quilt. He knew that, just like the birds, she had put her heart and soul into her creation. And he was grateful to have been a part of her journey.

outline: Tina had a paper due in two hours.

Tina was in a panic. She had a paper due in just two hours and she hadn't even started it yet. She sat at her desk, staring at her computer screen, feeling completely overwhelmed. Just then, she received a text from her friend Tom, asking if she wanted to meet up at the mall.

Desperate for a break from her work, Tina agreed. She met Tom at the mall and they wandered around, window shopping and catching up on each other's lives. However, Tina couldn't shake the thought of her looming deadline.

As they walked, Tom decided to pop into a store for a quick look around. But as soon as he stepped inside, the alarm went off. Tina's heart sank - this was the last thing she needed right now.

To her relief, it turned out that something Tom was wearing had set off the alarm. Tina breathed a sigh of relief and got back to work on her paper. She worked tirelessly for the next two hours, determined not to let this last-minute distraction ruin her grade.

Finally, she submitted her paper and waited anxiously for her grade to come back. To her delight, she ended up getting a great grade on the assignment.

As they left the mall, an employee stopped Tom and asked him some questions about what he was wearing. Tina couldn't believe it - she had been worried for nothing. It was clear that Tom hadn't stolen anything and he went on his way.

Tina felt a weight lifted off her shoulders, knowing that everything had worked out in the end. She smiled to herself, grateful for the unexpected distraction that had ultimately led to her success.

responses:
Jamie had always been a hard worker. Almost seven days a week, he would leave early in the morning and come back late at night, exhausted but satisfied with the work he had accomplished. He had never complained, but he couldn't help dreaming of the one thing he had always wanted: a Jeep Wrangler.

It was Jamie's birthday, and he was looking forward to going home after work. His wife had promised to cook his favorite meal, and he couldn't wait to spend some quality time with her. As he was about to leave, Adam, his colleague, frantically approached him. "Jamie, I'm expecting an important phone call. Can you carry my phone with you, just in case?"

Reluctantly, Jamie agreed, hoping Adam's call wouldn't ruin his plans. As he walked out of the office, he couldn't help but think about his dream car. He had been saving up for years, but life always seemed to get in the way.

When Jamie arrived home, his wife was waiting for him with a big smile on her face. "Happy birthday, Jamie!" she exclaimed. "I have a surprise for you!" Jamie couldn't believe his eyes when he saw his wife standing beside a brand new Jeep with a giant bow on it. He was so excited he couldn't wait to go for a ride with her.

Meanwhile, Adam was surprised that nobody had called him all day. He checked his phone, but there were no missed calls or messages. He started to worry that he had missed something important.

As Jamie and his wife were driving around town, enjoying their new ride, Adam called Jamie's phone. But it was on silent mode, and Jamie didn't hear it. Adam left a message, thanking Jamie for carrying his phone and apologizing for bothering him on his birthday.

Jamie didn't mind. He was too busy living his dream, driving his new Jeep with his wife by his side. He had never felt happier.

outline: Lisa turned thirty-five last weekend.

Becky walked along the road picking up rocks to fill the spaces.
responses:
Lisa had been dreading turning thirty-five, but her friends were determined to make it a memorable occasion. They threw her a surprise birthday party, and everyone that was close to Lisa attended. Becky, one of Lisa's friends, wanted to impress her pals and showed them her dad's prized collection of rocks. The guests were fascinated by the rare and beautiful specimens, and when Becky's pals begged, she let them each keep a rock.

As the night progressed, the party became a little too loud, and the neighbors called the police. The guests left in a hurry, and Becky looked at the empty spaces in her dad's collection. She felt guilty for giving away the rocks and vowed to replace them somehow.

Lisa will never forget this birthday party, but for Becky, it was a lesson learned. The next day, she walked along the road, picking up rocks to fill the spaces in her dad's collection. As she searched for the perfect specimens, she reflected on the previous night's events and realized that true friendship wasn't about impressing others. It was about being there for each other, no matter what.

In the end, Becky found the perfect rocks to replace the ones that were given away, and her dad's collection was once again complete. But more importantly, she learned the true value of friendship and vowed never to let her desire to impress others get in the way of what really mattered.

outline: Jeremy went to his parents house to gather things from his childhood.

Jeremy had been meaning to gather his childhood things from his parents' house for a while now. He finally got around to it and went to their house on a sunny Saturday afternoon. As he was rummaging through the boxes in the basement, he stumbled upon a few jars of old playdough. Jeremy was intrigued and excited to play with them again after all these years.

But alas, when he opened the jars, the playdough was as hard as a rock. Jeremy was disappointed but decided to throw them away in the trash. As he drove back home, he couldn't help but feel a little nostalgic about the good old days when he would spend hours molding the colorful dough.

Meanwhile, Anna was on a class trip to Thailand and Malaysia. Despite the jet lag, she quickly overcame it and started exploring the sights with her classmates. Her days were filled with exciting adventures and new experiences.

When Jeremy got home, he decided to buy fresh playdough to replace the old stuff he had found. As he started to play with it, he felt like a kid again, molding and shaping the dough into different shapes and figures.

Anna had an amazing time on her trip, soaking up the culture and making new friends. As she boarded the plane back home, she couldn't help but feel grateful for the opportunity to have such an incredible adventure.

Although Jeremy's childhood playdough was a disappointment, it had sparked a sense of nostalgia and childlike wonder in him. And as for Anna, her class trip had been an unforgettable experience that she would cherish for years to come.

Billy loved walking in the grass barefoot. It was his way of feeling free and connected to nature. But one day, while taking a stroll, a thorn pierced his foot. Billy screamed in pain, and his mother rushed to help him. She tried to remove the thorn, but it was too deep.

Meanwhile, Mike was celebrating his 21st birthday. He woke up early that day and quickly got dressed. He was excited to start drinking legally. Mike left his house and drove down to the local grocery store to buy some beers.

Back at Billy's house, his mother was still struggling to remove the thorn. Billy was in agony, and they were both getting desperate. They decided to call Mike, who was their neighbor and a good friend. Mike was nervous when he received the call. He didn't know how to help Billy, but he wanted to do something.

When Mike arrived at Billy's house, he saw the pain on his friend's face. He felt sorry for him and tried to remove the thorn himself, but he couldn't. Mike was very nervous to go home and actually try one of the beers he bought.

Finally, Billy's mother pulled the thorn out with tweezers. Billy felt a lot better, but Mike was still feeling restless. He decided to go home and drink the alcohol he bought, hoping it would calm his nerves. However, he got too drunk to even enjoy the alcohol.

In the end, Billy recovered from his injury, and Mike learned that alcohol isn't always the answer to his problems. They both had a memorable day, but for very different reasons.

responses:
Kate sat nervously on the edge of her seat, watching the lotto drawing on the TV screen. She clutched her ticket tightly in her hand, hoping and praying that she would be the lucky winner. As the numbers were called out, Kate's heart raced with anticipation. And then, when the final number was announced, she felt her whole body go numb. She had won!

Ecstatic, Kate rushed out of the house to share the news with her best friend, Allie. As she drove down the road, still in shock, Allie noticed that she was driving just a little too fast. "Slow down," she cautioned, "or you'll get pulled over."

But just as she finished speaking, the flashing lights of a police car appeared in the rearview mirror. Allie's heart sank as she pulled over to the side of the road, wondering what she could have done wrong.

Meanwhile, Kate was already on her way to the lottery office to claim her winnings. She was practically skipping down the street, her head filled with dreams of all the things she could now afford to do. But when she arrived at the office, she was met with a rude shock. She had heard the number wrong - she hadn't actually won the jackpot after all.

Allie, on the other hand, was still waiting nervously in her car, watching as the beautiful cop approached her window. But to her surprise, the cop let her off with a warning. "Just be more careful in the future," she said with a smile.

In the end, both Kate and Allie learned valuable lessons. Kate realized that sometimes, things don't always turn out the way we want them to, while Allie learned that even when things seem hopeless, there is always a chance for redemption. And both of them were grateful for the experience - and for each other.

Despite this setback, Joanna eventually met a good man and got married. Meanwhile, James still had the blood-stained jeans. Nothing seemed to get the blood out, and he was about to throw them away when his mom took them and somehow fixed them.

Kelsie couldn't wait to get home to ride her new bike up and down the street, but when Tonya was ready to pay for it, she realized that she was ten dollars short. Just then, Randy's kids came over to check on him and Tonya explained her situation to them.

As luck would have it, the person in line behind Tonya overheard their conversation and generously offered to pay for the bike. Tonya was so touched that she cried.

They rushed Randy to the hospital where he underwent surgery and made a full recovery. Tonya was grateful for the stranger's kindness and the fact that her daughter got her new bike, but most of all, she was thankful that Randy was okay.

responses:
Julie was looking for some extra spending money and decided to set up a lemonade stand. She went to the playground where she knew there would be lots of kids playing and thirsty for a cold drink. To her delight, the stand quickly became popular and she was selling cups of lemonade left and right.

Meanwhile, Cameron was playing at the playground when he noticed that one of his friends was crying. He went over to see what was wrong and learned that his friend was upset because he couldn't play on the see-saw by himself. Cameron asked his friend if he could help him and the two of them played on the see-saw together.

As the afternoon wore on, the neighbors started to take notice of the lemonade stand and wanted to get a taste. Julie happily served them and even gave out some free samples to entice them to buy a cup. By the end of the day, Julie had made 100 dollars and was thrilled with the success of her stand.

Cameron's friend was still sad that he couldn't play on the see-saw by himself, so Cameron had an idea. He asked his friend if he would like to play on the see-saw with him and his new friend agreed. The three of them played together until it was time to go home.

Julie packed up her stand and headed home, proud of the money she had made and the joy she had brought to the playground. Cameron and his friend also left the playground happy, having made a new friend and with the knowledge that they had helped each other out. It was a great day for everyone involved.

responses:
Betty had been struggling with her weight for years. She tried every diet in the book, but none of them seemed to work. All she could think about was the chocolate cake and candy that she loved so much. But she was determined to lose weight, so she kept trying.

One day, she met up with her friend Mickey at the ice cream shop. Mickey was craving strawberry ice cream, but they had run out. Betty was disappointed that she couldn't have her favorite treat, but she didn't want to give up.

As they stood in front of the ice cream counter, Mickey had to choose between chocolate and vanilla. Betty suddenly had a better idea. "Why don't we go for a walk instead?" she suggested.

Mickey agreed, and they headed out for a brisk hour-long walk. Betty was determined to make this a daily habit. She continued walking every day, and before she knew it, she had lost 25 pounds.

Mickey, on the other hand, was less than satisfied with Mickey's ice cream. But Betty was proud of herself. She had found a way to lose weight without giving up her favorite sweets. She had found a way to enjoy life and be healthy at the same time.

As they were walking to the bar, Sam's car ran out of gas. They were both frustrated and didn't know what to do. Corey was tempted to keep working, but he knew that he needed a way to deal with the stress. That's when his friend suggested that he start practicing meditation. 

Corey took his friend's advice and researched different meditation techniques until he found one that worked. He was soon able to manage his stress levels and was happy to keep working. Meanwhile, Sam only had enough money for either beer or gasoline. He decided to get the gasoline and wait on the beer. 

After some time, Corey's hard work paid off, and he was able to manage his job without feeling overwhelmed. It was a smart choice, and Sam was proud of his friend. They both realized that sometimes the best solution to a problem is to take a step back, assess the situation, and find a way to deal with it in a calm and focused manner.

outline: James was playing video names when he got a bloody nose.
Ray worked in the fashion industry.
The blood came out quickly, staining James' jeans.
Every season, Ray needs a new suit to keep up with style.
When the bleeding stopped James was left to deal with the mess.
Last autumn, Ray tried a suit that was radical looking.
Nothing seemed to get the blood out of James' pants.
Ray knew it was a risk to wear it in Ray's industry.
Luckily, James' mom took the pants and somehow fixed them.
The risk paid off, and Ray started a new trend altogether.
responses:
James was deep into his video games when he suddenly felt a tickle in his nose. Without warning, he got a bloody nose, and blood gushed out, staining his jeans. He panicked, not knowing what to do. Before he could think of anything, his mom rushed to his side and helped him stop the bleeding. However, the mess was left for James to deal with.

Meanwhile, Ray was hard at work in the fashion industry. Every season, he needed a new suit to keep up with the ever-changing trends. The previous autumn, Ray had taken a risk and tried a suit that was radical looking. He knew it was a gamble, but he was confident that it would pay off in the end.

Sadly, nothing seemed to get the blood out of James' pants. Ray knew it was a risk to wear his experimental suit in the industry, but he went ahead with his plan anyway. The stakes were high, and he was determined to make a statement.

Fortunately, James' mom came to the rescue. She took the stained pants and somehow managed to remove the stubborn bloodstains. Ray wore his suit with confidence, and it paid off. His daring fashion choice sparked a new trend that took the fashion industry by storm.

In the end, James and Ray both learned a valuable lesson. James learned that accidents happen, but there's always a solution. Ray learned that taking risks can lead to great rewards, but it's important to be prepared for the consequences. Together, they made a formidable team, and their experiences brought them closer than ever before.

outline: It was Sue's time to renew her cell phone contract.
Ronald was taking intro to Anatomy.
Sue was excited about getting the latest phone.
Ronald was grouped with three beautiful women.
Sue went into the store and found the phone Sue wanted.
Ronald had no idea what to really expect being sheltered all Ronald's life.
With a new contract Sue's phone was only one dollar.
Ronald's face turned bright red as soon as the teacher started speaking.
Sue happily paid the one dollar and got a new phone case too.
The group giggled but Ronald learned quite a few things.
responses:
Sue had been eagerly waiting for this day for months. It was finally time to renew her cell phone contract. She had been saving up and was excited to get her hands on the latest phone. As she walked into the store, her eyes lit up at the sight of the phone she had been eyeing for weeks.

Meanwhile, Ronald was nervously sitting in his intro to Anatomy class. Being sheltered all his life, he had no idea what to really expect. As the teacher started speaking, Ronald's face turned bright red. He was grouped with three beautiful women who seemed to be well-versed in the subject.

Back in the store, Sue happily paid the one dollar and got a new phone case too. With the new contract, her phone was practically free. She was over the moon and couldn't wait to show off her new device.

In the classroom, the group giggled but Ronald learned quite a few things. Despite feeling out of his depth, he was grateful for the opportunity to learn and grow.

As Sue left the store, phone in hand, she felt a sense of satisfaction wash over her. She had gotten what she wanted and was excited to put it to use. Ronald too, left the classroom feeling more confident in his ability to navigate new experiences. Though they had never met, both Sue and Ronald were grateful for the opportunities that the day had brought them.

outline: Doug is drunk.
John realized he had a midterm exam tomorrow.
Doug argues with Doug's son.
John had not studied one bit for this exam.
Doug fights with Doug's son.
John started cramming for the exam.
Doug bloodies the face of Doug's son.
John studied for hours into the night.
Doug gets arrested for Doug's violence.
John barely passed John's midterm that morning.
responses:
Doug stumbled out of the bar, his mind hazy from the alcohol. He fumbled with his phone, trying to call his son, but his fingers were too numb to dial the right number. As he stumbled down the dark alleyway, he heard the sound of footsteps behind him. He turned around to see his son, who had been trying to call him all night.

"What do you want?" Doug slurred, his words barely intelligible.

"I just wanted to make sure you were okay," his son replied, concern etched on his face.

Doug's mood darkened. "I don't need your help. I can take care of myself."

The argument escalated quickly, with both men shouting at each other. Doug's son tried to reason with him, but Doug was too drunk to listen. In a fit of rage, Doug lashed out and punched his son in the face. The sound of the impact echoed through the alleyway, and Doug's son crumpled to the ground, blood streaming down his face.

Meanwhile, John was in his dorm room, scrolling through his phone when he realized he had a midterm exam the next day. Panic set in as he realized he had not studied one bit for the exam. He knew he had to cram if he had any chance of passing.

As John buried himself in his textbooks, Doug was being arrested for his violence. He was too drunk to resist and was taken away in handcuffs.

John studied for hours into the night, his eyes bleary and his mind numb. He felt like he was drowning in information, but he refused to give up. As the sun began to rise, John stumbled out of his dorm room and made his way to the classroom for the midterm exam.

The exam was brutal, but John managed to scrape by with a passing grade. He was relieved but exhausted. As he walked back to his dorm, he saw Doug's son sitting on a bench outside the police station. John hesitated for a moment before approaching him.

"Are you okay?" John asked tentatively.

Doug's son looked up at him, his face bruised and swollen. "I'll be okay," he replied, his voice hoarse.

John nodded, feeling a sense of sadness and anger wash over him. He knew that alcohol and violence had caused so much pain and suffering for so many people, including Doug's son and himself. But for now, all he could do was try to move forward and learn from his mistakes.

outline: John was a graphic designer.
Fernando wanted to capture the majestic beauty of the Alps.
John decided to use his skills to make phoney coupons.
Fernando bought a ticket to go up the mountain.
John took them to the supermarket and handed them to the cashier.
On top, it was so cold that Fernando's hands were shaking.
The coupons made everything in John's cart free.
When it was time to take the pictures Fernando wanted, Fernando couldn't.
The cashier did not suspect John and accepted all of the coupons.
Fernando all came shaky and unfocused.
responses:
John was a freelance graphic designer who had been struggling to pay his bills. One day, his friend Fernando approached him with a proposition. Fernando wanted to capture the majestic beauty of the Alps and needed John's help to do it. John, who had been feeling creatively drained, jumped at the opportunity.

But John had a secret. He decided to use his graphic design skills to make phoney coupons. He took Fernando to the supermarket and handed them to the cashier. To their surprise, the cashier did not suspect anything and accepted all of the coupons, making everything in John's cart free.

Excited by their success, John and Fernando took the coupons and headed up the mountain. The cold was unbearable at the top, and Fernando's hands were shaking. When it was time to take the pictures Fernando wanted, he couldn't keep his hands steady. Everything came out shaky and unfocused.

Despite the setback, John and Fernando were thrilled with their free haul. They went back down the mountain, feeling like they had accomplished something great. But little did they know, their actions would have consequences. The supermarket manager soon discovered the fraudulent coupons and reported it to the police.

John was arrested and charged with theft. Fernando was left to deal with the guilt of unknowingly participating in a criminal act. The experience taught them both a valuable lesson about the consequences of their actions.

outline: Kelly took her sled to the top of the snow-covered hill in the park.
Neil was ending his visit to Germany.
Kelly carefully laid on her belly on the sled.
Neil decided his last sight would be the Black Forest.
Slowly, Kelly pushed herself over the crest of the hill.
Neil took a train ride to the beautiful location.
The sled quickly picked up speed as Kelly glided down the hill.
Neil thought of the German fairy tales set here.
Kelly laughed all the way to the bottom.
Neil thought the forest was spooky, but beautiful nonetheless!
responses:
Kelly had been waiting for the first snowfall to bring out her sled. Finally, the day arrived, and she rushed to the park with her sled in tow. At the top of the snow-covered hill, she carefully laid on her belly on the sled and pushed herself over the crest of the hill. The sled quickly picked up speed, and Kelly laughed all the way to the bottom.

Meanwhile, Neil was ending his visit to Germany. He had seen many beautiful sights during his stay, but he had one last place he wanted to visit – the Black Forest. He took a train ride to the beautiful location, thinking of the German fairy tales set here. As he walked through the forest, he couldn't help but feel a little spooked, but it was beautiful nonetheless.

As Kelly climbed back up the hill for another ride, she noticed a man walking through the forest. It was Neil, taking in the sights before he left Germany. They exchanged a smile, and Kelly went back to her sled.

After a few more rides, Kelly saw that Neil was still in the forest, lost in thought. She decided to say goodbye before leaving the park. As she approached him, Neil looked up and greeted her warmly. They chatted for a few minutes, and Kelly told him about the fun she had on her sled. Neil smiled and said he was glad she enjoyed herself.

As Kelly walked away, Neil thought about the little girl's laughter and how it echoed through the forest. He knew he would never forget this place, even after he returned home.

outline: Gina wanted a brand new desk like the new boy in her class.
Tom was a rookie hiker who decided to hike by himself.
Gina wanted to ask her teacher, but Gina was helping another student.
Tom was having a great time on a hike Tom had done many times.
As Gina waited, other students were discussing the new desk.
Losing track of time, the sun went down, leaving Tom in darkness.
Gina hadn't realized anyone else felt the same way Gina did.
Tom was lost, because everything looked much different at night.
Gina knew if Gina didn't ask first, Gina wouldn't be getting a new desk.
Eventually, Tom found his way home by following the north star.
responses:
Gina had been eyeing the new boy's desk in class for weeks. It was shiny, modern, and had more drawers than she could count. She knew she had to have one just like it. But she didn't know where to start. She had never seen a desk like that before. 

One day, as she was about to ask her teacher about it, she noticed another student struggling with their work. Gina couldn't ignore their need for help, so she stayed behind to assist. By the time she finished, class was over, and the teacher had left. Gina was too shy to ask anyone else about the desk. 

Meanwhile, Tom had decided to go on a solo hike. He had done this trail many times before and felt confident he could do it without a guide. He was having a great time, taking in the sights, and enjoying the solitude of the forest. But he didn't realize how quickly the day had gone by. Before he knew it, the sun was setting, and he was still miles away from the trailhead. 

As Gina waited for her chance to ask about the desk, she overheard other students discussing it. She was shocked to learn that many of them wanted a similar desk. Gina hadn't realized that anyone else felt the same way she did. 

Meanwhile, Tom was lost. The trail looked much different at night, and he couldn't find his way back. He tried retracing his steps, but everything looked the same in the dark. He was scared and alone. 

Gina knew that if she didn't ask about the desk soon, she might miss out on getting one. But she didn't want to leave the other student she was helping. She was torn. 

Tom knew he had to find a way to get back home. He remembered learning about the north star in school and decided to use it as his guide. He followed it until he reached the trailhead and made his way back home. 

The next day, Gina finally got the courage to ask her teacher about the desk. But she was disappointed to learn that they were no longer available. She felt like she had missed her chance. 

As Gina sat at her old desk, she realized that sometimes things don't work out the way we want them to. But she also learned that it's essential to help others, even if it means sacrificing something we want. And as for Tom, he learned that sometimes the most unexpected things can be our saving grace, like the north star guiding him home.

outline: Ted had finals coming up.
Sally and Tommy saw a family of Syrian refugees on TV.
Ted knew that Ted did not study enough this semester.
Sally and Tommy were sad and wanted to help.
Ted stayed up all late all week studying.
Sally and Tommy decided to have a lemonade stand.
When test day came around Ted was so tired Ted slept all day.
Sally and Tommy sold lemonade all day Saturday.
Ted failed all his test, and had to retake all his classes.
Tommy and Sally felt glad Tommy and Sally raised fifty two dollars.
responses:
Ted had finals coming up, and he knew he hadn't studied enough this semester. He was feeling overwhelmed and stressed, spending late nights cramming for exams. Meanwhile, Sally and Tommy were watching TV and saw a family of Syrian refugees who had lost everything in their home country. They felt sad and wanted to help in any way they could.

As Ted continued to study, Sally and Tommy decided to have a lemonade stand to raise money for the refugees they had seen on TV. They worked hard all week to get everything ready, and on Saturday they set up their stand in the park.

Test day came around, and Ted was so tired from staying up late all week that he slept through the entire day. When he woke up, he realized he had missed all his exams and would have to retake all his classes.

Meanwhile, Sally and Tommy had sold lemonade all day and raised fifty-two dollars. They felt proud of their accomplishment and grateful for the opportunity to help those in need.

Although Ted had failed all his tests and had to retake his classes, he realized that he needed to prioritize his time better and couldn't let stress and exhaustion get the best of him. He decided to take a break from studying and help Sally and Tommy organize another fundraiser for the refugees. Together, they were able to make a difference in the lives of others, while also learning valuable lessons about hard work, compassion, and the importance of balancing responsibilities.

outline: Kim had an online diary that she wrote in daily.
Ruth's neighbor was religious.
Kim was very candid and put everything in the diary.
Ruth's neighbor invited Ruth over for a bible study.
One day, Kim was very mad at her boss and wrote about it.
Ruth reluctantly agreed.
Kim soon realized that Kim was not in Kim's diary, but on Facebook!
Ruth and her neighbor read several passages and discussed them.
Everyone saw Kim's post and Kim was fired the next day!
When Ruth and her neighbor were done, Ruth went home.
responses:
Kim had always been an avid writer and had an online diary that she wrote in daily. She was very candid and put everything in the diary, including her frustrations with her boss. One day, after a particularly bad day at work, Kim wrote a scathing entry in her diary about her boss. Little did she know that she had accidentally posted it on Facebook instead of in her diary.

Meanwhile, Ruth's neighbor was a devoutly religious person who often invited Ruth over for bible study. Ruth was always hesitant, but eventually agreed to attend one day. While there, Ruth and her neighbor read several passages and discussed them at length.

However, their study session was disrupted when everyone in attendance saw Kim's post about her boss on Facebook. The next day, Kim was fired from her job due to the inflammatory post.

Kim was devastated and embarrassed, but she learned a valuable lesson about the importance of double-checking her posts before sharing them online. Ruth and her neighbor finished their bible study and Ruth went home, still in shock over what had transpired.

outline: Bobby got into the cheese puffs.
Julie was looking for some extra spending money.
Bobby's mother told Bobby to wait until after dinner, but Bobby couldn't.
Julie decided to open up a lemonade stand.
Bobby thought Bobby'd gotten away with it.
To Julie's delight the stand became quite popular.
Then Bobby realized Bobby had bright orange cheese all over Bobby's fingers.
The neighbors wanted to get a taste.
Bobby's mother didn't let Bobby have dessert that night as punishment.
At the end of the day Julie made 100 dollars.
responses:
Bobby couldn't resist the cheese puffs any longer. His mother had told him to wait until after dinner, but the cheesy goodness was too tempting. He thought he had gotten away with it until he looked down at his bright orange fingers. 

Meanwhile, Julie was in need of some extra spending money. She decided to open up a lemonade stand in her front yard. To her delight, the stand became quite popular among the neighborhood. 

As the day went on, the neighbors started to take notice of Julie's stand and wanted to get a taste. But as they approached, they couldn't help but notice Bobby's bright orange fingers. 

Bobby's mother found out about his cheese puff escapade and punished him by not letting him have dessert that night. 

At the end of the day, Julie had made 100 dollars from her lemonade stand. Despite his punishment, Bobby couldn't help but feel a little jealous of her success.

outline: Fernando wanted to capture the majestic beauty of the Alps.
Ashley bought a dogsled.
Fernando bought a ticket to go up the mountain.
Ashley wanted to test it out.
On top, it was so cold that Fernando's hands were shaking.
Ashley went outside in the snow.
When it was time to take the pictures Fernando wanted, Fernando couldn't.
Ashley climbed to the top of a hill.
Fernando all came shaky and unfocused.
Ashley then rode it to the bottom.
responses: Fernando had always dreamed of capturing the majestic beauty of the Alps. He bought a ticket to go up the mountain, hoping to get the perfect shot. On top, it was so cold that his hands were shaking. He tried to steady himself but to no avail. Ashley, on the other hand, had other plans. She had just bought a dogsled and wanted to test it out. She went outside in the snow, and Fernando followed her. When it was time to take the pictures Fernando wanted, he couldn't. His hands were too shaky, and his lens kept fogging up. Ashley climbed to the top of a hill and called out to Fernando, who all came shaky and unfocused. Ashley then rode it to the bottom, feeling exhilarated. Fernando was disappointed that he couldn't capture the perfect shot, but Ashley reminded him that sometimes, it's not just about the destination, but the journey and the memories made along the way.

outline: Lucy was eating in the dark.
Kim's lips felt dry.
Lucy was depressed.
Kim got some lip gloss that promised to make Kim's lips moist.
Lucy ate cold chicken and went to bed.
Kim slathered it on and rubbed Kim's lips together.
Lucy left the bones and the crumbs on the table.
Kim felt a horrible tingling and burning.
The next day Lucy's grandma scolded Lucy for leaving a mess.
Kim was allergic to the gloss!
responses:
Lucy sat alone at the kitchen table, eating her dinner in the dark. She felt depressed, and the only thing that seemed to bring her any comfort was the cold chicken she had left over from last night. After finishing her meal, she left the bones and crumbs on the table and went to bed.

Meanwhile, Kim was sitting in her room, feeling self-conscious about her dry lips. She had just purchased a new lip gloss that promised to make her lips moist, so she decided to give it a try. As she slathered it on and rubbed her lips together, she felt a horrible tingling and burning sensation.

The next day, Lucy's grandma scolded her for leaving a mess on the table. Feeling guilty, Lucy apologized and cleaned up the leftovers. But little did she know, the real trouble began with Kim.

It turned out that Kim was allergic to the gloss! Her lips swelled up and she had to be rushed to the hospital. Lucy felt terrible when she found out and went to visit Kim in the hospital. Kim told her about the gloss and Lucy realized that she had seen it before when she was eating in the dark.

Feeling responsible for what had happened, Lucy decided to take action. She contacted the company that made the gloss and told them about Kim's allergic reaction. The company pulled the product from the shelves and offered to pay for Kim's medical bills.

In the end, Lucy learned that even the smallest actions can have big consequences. She promised to always be more careful in the future, and Kim learned to always read the label before trying a new product.

outline: Kelly liked the boy that sat next to her in class.
Mary needed to find a dress to wear to her high school prom.
Kelly decided to ask the boy out one day.
Mary went to many stores and couldn't find a dress Mary liked.
The boy told Kelly that he wasn't interested, but the boy was just shy.
Finally, Mary found a blue dress that looked very pretty.
After a week the boy told Kelly the truth and the boy went out.
On prom night, everyone commented on how lovely Mary's dress looked.
Kelly and the boy are now dating and Kelly and the boy are both happy.
Mary felt happy that Mary had such a nice dress.
responses:
Kelly had always liked the boy who sat next to her in class. His name was Alex, and he had a quiet, thoughtful air about him that Kelly found intriguing. One day, she worked up the courage to ask him out.

Unfortunately, Alex turned her down. He told Kelly that he wasn't interested in dating anyone right now, but Kelly suspected that he was just shy.

Meanwhile, Mary was in a panic. The high school prom was coming up and she still hadn't found a dress. She scoured every store in town, but nothing seemed to fit quite right or look quite right.

Finally, Mary found a blue dress that looked very pretty. It hugged her curves in all the right places and made her eyes sparkle. On prom night, everyone commented on how lovely she looked.

A week after the prom, Alex came clean to Kelly. He told her that he had been nervous about going out with her, but now he realized that he really liked her. Kelly was thrilled.

Now, Kelly and Alex are dating and they're both happy. Mary, too, is happy that she found such a nice dress for the prom. It's funny how things work out sometimes.

outline: Holly had always wanted to pursue a Master's in Public Health.
Emma fell in love with Paul.
Holly worked hard academically to maintain a good grade point average.
Paul didn't feel the same for Emma and rejected Emma.
Holly also interned with the local Health Department to gain experience.
Emma's feelings were hurt, so Emma told the authorities.
During Holly's senior year Holly was able to apply to graduate schools.
Emma felt even worse when the authorities wouldn't listen.
Holly's internships and grades earned Holly a spot in graduate school!
Emma walked under a mattress for a year to show everyone Emma's feelings.
responses:
Holly had always known that she wanted to pursue a Master's in Public Health. She worked hard academically to maintain a good grade point average and interned with the local Health Department to gain experience. During her senior year, she was able to apply to graduate schools and was thrilled when she earned a spot.

Meanwhile, Holly's friend Emma had fallen in love with a guy named Paul. Unfortunately, Paul didn't feel the same way and rejected Emma. Emma's feelings were hurt, so she told the authorities about Paul. Unfortunately, they didn't listen.

Emma felt even worse when she heard about Holly's success. She was jealous that Holly was able to achieve her dreams while Emma's own dreams had been crushed. Emma decided to walk under a mattress for a year to show everyone how she felt.

Holly was confused when she first heard about Emma's strange behavior, but she soon understood. She tried to talk to Emma and help her deal with her emotions, but Emma was too upset to listen.

Despite the drama with Emma, Holly was thrilled to be starting her graduate program. She knew that she had worked hard to get where she was, and she was excited to continue learning and growing in her field. Holly was grateful for the opportunities she had been given, and she was determined to make the most of them.

outline: Tom wanted to buy a gun.
Stan styled his hair like a popular singer.
Tom decided to go to the shooting range.
Stan loved it when girls remarked on the resemblance.
Tom figured it would be a good place to learn about guns.
One day, news broke about the popular singer in an embarrassing scandal.
Everyone Tom talked to was an idiot.
Stan looked at himself in the mirror.
It made Tom rethink Tom's gun culture.
Then Stan got out a razor and shaved off Stan's hair.
responses:
Tom had been considering buying a gun for a while. He didn't like the idea of being defenseless in a dangerous world. He had heard that the shooting range was a good place to learn about guns, so he decided to go. 

At the shooting range, Tom met Stan. Stan had styled his hair to resemble a popular singer, and he loved it when girls remarked on the resemblance. Tom thought Stan was ridiculous, but he didn't say anything. 

Tom was learning about guns when news broke about the popular singer in an embarrassing scandal. Everyone Tom talked to was an idiot. They were all talking about the scandal and not paying attention to the guns. 

Tom started to rethink his gun culture. He realized that owning a gun didn't make him safer. It just made him more paranoid. He decided not to buy a gun after all. 

Meanwhile, Stan was looking at himself in the mirror. He realized that he didn't want to be known as the guy who styled his hair like a popular singer. He got out a razor and shaved off his hair. 

Tom never saw Stan again, but he heard that Stan had moved to a different city and started a new life. Tom was happy for him. He realized that sometimes it takes a scandal or a shaved head to make us see things differently.

outline: Lagertha didn't like being told what to do.
Cody had really nice skin until he was about 8 years old.
Lagertha's mother told Lagertha to clean Lagertha's room.
Shortly after Cody's 8th birthday Cody's skin began to itch.
Lagertha refused, and went outside to play with Lagertha's friends.
As time went on Cody's skin began to peel and it would cause Cody pain.
When Lagertha returned at dusk, there was candy and roast lamb to eat.
Cody went to the Doctor who ordered tests which showed Cody had eczema.
Lagertha's mother forbid her to have any though, and sent her to her room.
Cody was then prescribed special lotions and now Cody's skin is better.
responses:
Lagertha was a stubborn child who never liked being told what to do. One day, her mother asked her to clean her messy room. But Lagertha refused and went outside to play with her friends.

Meanwhile, Cody, a boy with really nice skin, suddenly developed an itch on his skin shortly after his 8th birthday. As time went on, his skin began to peel, causing him immense pain.

Lagertha returned home at dusk to find candy and roast lamb waiting for her. However, her mother forbade her from having any and sent her to her room as punishment for not cleaning up.

Cody's mother took him to the doctor, who ordered tests that showed Cody had eczema. The doctor prescribed special lotions, and after some time, Cody's skin began to heal and regain its original beauty.

In the end, Lagertha learned her lesson and started cleaning her room regularly, while Cody was grateful for his new skin.

outline: Gina's mom had been slowly packing her mother's things.
There was a clown at Eddy's friend's birthday party.
Gina's mom was taking her mother to Minnesota with Gina's mom.
Eddy couldn't get over how big the clown's feet were.
Gina helped Gina's mom every once in awhile.
Eddy asked his mom if people had to have big feet to be clowns.
Today Gina had nothing else to do.
Eddy's mom laughed at his question.
Gina decided to spend 3 hours helping with the packing.
Eddy's mom told Eddy that they wore big shoes, but they didn't have extra big feet.
responses:
Gina's mom had been slowly packing her mother's things. It was a difficult task for her, emotionally, but she knew it was necessary. Meanwhile, Eddy was excited about his friend's birthday party. There was a clown at the party, and Eddy couldn't get over how big the clown's feet were. He asked his mom if people had to have big feet to be clowns. She laughed at his question and told him that they wore big shoes, but they didn't have extra big feet.

Gina helped her mom every once in a while, but today she had nothing else to do. She decided to spend three hours helping with the packing. As they were going through her grandmother's things, Gina's mom told her that she was taking her mother to Minnesota with her. Gina was happy to hear that her grandmother would be with her mom, but sad that she wouldn't be around anymore.

In the meantime, Eddy's mom dropped him off at home after the birthday party. He was still talking about the clown's big feet. Gina's mom told him that she was packing her mother's things, and Eddy asked if she was packing the clown's shoes. They all laughed at the thought.

As the day drew to a close, Gina's mom finished packing for the day. She was grateful for her daughter's help and hugged her tightly. Gina hugged her back, feeling a sense of warmth and love. She knew that even though her grandmother was leaving, she would always have her memories. And as for Eddy, well, he would always be fascinated by clowns and their big shoes.

outline: Nellie fell asleep on the sand at the beach.
Charles was about twenty years older than the kids on the court.
Nellie dozed peacefully for a few hours.
But Charles knew moves with a basketball they couldn't imagine.
But when Nellie woke, Nellie panicked.
During a game this summer the score was tied.
Nellie was covered head-to-toe in heavy wet sand!
Charles had the ball and Charles' team needed one basket to win.
Nellie's little brother had buried Nellie in sand while Nellie slept!
Charles pretended to be nervous and then sunk a jump shot!
responses:
Nellie had been looking forward to her beach day all week. She was excited to lay in the sun, dip her toes in the water, and read her book. After a few hours of soaking up the sun, she dozed off on the warm sand.

Meanwhile, a group of boys were playing basketball nearby. Charles, who was quite a bit older than the kids, had joined in on the game. The boys were good, but Charles knew moves with a basketball they couldn't imagine.

Nellie dozed peacefully for a few hours, but when she woke, she panicked. She was covered head-to-toe in heavy wet sand! Her little brother had buried her in sand while she slept.

During a game this summer, the score was tied. Charles had the ball and his team needed one basket to win. Nellie, still disoriented from waking up in a pile of sand, stumbled over to the basketball court to see what was going on.

Charles saw Nellie and decided to have a little fun. He pretended to be nervous and then sunk a jump shot, winning the game for his team. Nellie couldn't believe it. She was still trying to shake off the sand and here was Charles, sinking a game-winning shot with ease.

Despite the strange turn of events, Nellie couldn't help but laugh. Charles had made her forget about the sand and the confusion. She thanked him for the entertainment and headed back to her towel, ready to relax once more.

outline: Last summer was incredibly hot.
Tim was trying to wash dishes.
My friend Dalton spent almost the whole summer in Dalton's house.
Tim noticed the water wouldn't drain.
There was one day where Dalton spent all day at my house though.
Tim tried using a plunger to fix it.
It was the day that Dalton's air conditioner broke.
After a bit of trying the water started to leave.
I sort of wish Dalton's air conditioner had broken more often.
Tim plunged a bit more just to make sure.
responses:
Last summer was one of the hottest on record, and Tim was struggling to wash dishes in the sweltering heat. His friend Dalton had spent nearly the entire summer cooped up in his air-conditioned house, but there was one day when he ventured out and visited Tim's house. 

While they were hanging out, Tim noticed that the water in his sink wasn't draining properly. He tried using a plunger to fix it, but it didn't seem to work. Meanwhile, Dalton's air conditioner broke, leaving him sweating and uncomfortable.
