Joel had always been known for being very stingy with his money. He would save every penny he could and never spent on anything that was not absolutely necessary. Joel always feared he would need to use his savings for an emergency, so he kept on saving.

Lola, Joel's wife, was planning to go to the beach with her husband. She was excited to finally go on a vacation, but Joel was hesitant. He had never taken a vacation or bought anything for himself, and he feared he would need the money.

Lola told her relatives about the beach trip, and her aunt expressed interest in joining them. Joel kept on saving, and Lola's aunt confirmed that she would be joining them.

However, before the trip, Lola and Max had a fight that left them both upset. Joel felt regretful for never spending more on himself after he retired. He realized that he had missed out on so much because of his stingy ways.

Lola also felt bad that she couldn't realize her plans. She had been looking forward to the trip for so long, and now it seemed like it was not going to happen.

In the end, Joel decided to take the money he had saved and surprise Lola with a trip to the beach. He knew it was time to start enjoying life and spending his money on things that mattered. Lola was overjoyed, and they had the time of their lives on the beach. They both realized that life was too short to worry about money and that sometimes, it's okay to splurge a little.

outline: Becky wanted to impress her pals.
Tim woke up early one day.
Becky showed her pals her dad's prized collection of rocks.
Tim decided to eat cereal before work.
When Becky's pals begged, Becky let Becky's pals each keep a rock.
After taking a bite Tim realized it was stale.
The pals left, and Becky looked at the empty spaces in her dad's collection.
Tim decided Tim didn't care.
Becky walked along the road picking up rocks to fill the spaces.
Tim kept eating it after it soaked in the milk a bit.
responses:
Becky had always wanted to impress her pals, so when they came over one day, she decided to show them her dad's prized collection of rocks. As they marveled at the unique shapes and colors, Becky couldn't resist the pleading looks on her friends' faces, and she let them each keep a rock.

Meanwhile, Tim had woken up early for work and decided to eat cereal before heading out. But after taking a bite, he realized it was stale. He kept eating it after it soaked in the milk a bit, though.

After Becky's pals left, she looked at the empty spaces in her dad's collection and felt guilty. Determined to fix her mistake, she walked along the road picking up rocks to fill the spaces.

Tim, on the other hand, decided he didn't care about the stale cereal and went about his day. But as he worked, he couldn't shake the feeling that something was missing.

Later that day, Becky proudly showed her dad the new rocks she had collected to replace the ones she had given away. Her dad was pleased but confused as to why she had done it.

Tim, on the other hand, realized what was missing: the satisfaction of a fresh breakfast. The next morning, he made sure to check the expiration date before pouring his cereal.

As for Becky, she learned that impressing her friends wasn't worth sacrificing something important to her dad. From that day on, she made sure to ask before sharing his collection again.

outline: Cody had really nice skin until he was about 8 years old.
Sam loved to fish.
Shortly after Cody's 8th birthday Cody's skin began to itch.
Sam would go out onto the lake often.
As time went on Cody's skin began to peel and it would cause Cody pain.
One day Sam caught a huge fish!
Cody went to the Doctor who ordered tests which showed Cody had eczema.
Sam took Sam's eyes off it for one second and it flopped away!
Cody was then prescribed special lotions and now Cody's skin is better.
Sam wanted the fish so badly Sam dived in after it!
responses:
Cody had always been proud of his skin, it was smooth and clear until he turned eight. His mother tried everything to soothe the itch that started to bother him but nothing seemed to work. Meanwhile, Sam, Cody's neighbor, spent most of his days fishing on the lake behind their houses. He loved the peace and quiet of the water, and the satisfaction of catching a big one.

Cody's skin began to peel, which caused him pain and embarrassment. He couldn't wear short sleeves or shorts anymore, and he stopped going outside to play with his friends. One day, as Sam was fishing, he caught a huge fish. He was so excited that he took his eyes off the fish for a second, and it flopped away. Sam was disappointed, but he didn't give up. He stayed on the lake until the sun began to set.

Cody's mother took him to the doctor, who ordered tests that revealed Cody had eczema. The doctor prescribed special lotions, which helped ease the constant itch and pain. Cody's skin slowly got better, and he could finally play outside with his friends again.

One day, as Sam was fishing, he caught the same huge fish he had lost before. He was so excited that he jumped into the water after it, determined not to let it get away again. As he swam after the fish, he felt a sharp pain on his leg. He looked down to see that he had been bitten by a snapping turtle. Sam quickly swam back to shore, and Cody's mother helped him clean and bandage the wound.

From that day on, Sam still went fishing, but he was more careful. Cody's skin was better, and he was happy to be able to enjoy the outdoors again. And while Sam never caught that huge fish again, he was happy just to be out on the water, enjoying the peace and quiet.
